Title:
Aspergillus keveioides, a new species of sect. Usti from
Shandong Province, China
Keywords: new taxon; morphology; phylogeny; polyphasic taxonomy
Abstract:
A new Aspergillus species, A. keveioides (AS3.15305T = CBS
132737) was isolated from soil in Shandong Province, China.
Morphologically, it resembled A. pseudodeflectus, A. germanicus, A.
insuetus, A. keveii and A. thesauricus, but was readily different from
them by sparse conidiogenesis, smooth and warty stipe walls with
conspicuous concretions, and globose warty conidia. The analyses of
partial Î²-tubulin gene (BenA), calmodulin gene (CaM) and rDNA
ITS1-5.8S-ITS2 sequence data showed that A. keveioides fell in the clade
with A. keveii, A. insuetus, germanicus and A. thesauricus, and proved
that A. keveioides was a distinctive member lacking close relatives
among described species of sect. Usti.
